author: Zakiya Jamal
title: Under Donald Trump’s Immigration Rules, Melania Would’ve Been Deported
text:
February 24, 2017 by Zakiya Jamal 0 Shares Advertisement 
Does President Donald Trump forget that his wife was an immigrant? 
It sure seems that way after it emerged that, had his new immigration rules been in effect in the 90s, his own wife probably would have been deported. 
It turns out Melania Trump would’ve fallen under the terms of his new executive order prioritizing the deportation of a number of classes of individuals. 
At the end of the election last year, the Associated Press discovered documents that revealed the now First Lady was paid for 10 modeling jobs in the United States worth $20,056. 
The problem? She didn’t get legal permission to work in the country until seven weeks later. 
At the time, the 46-year old only had a B1/B2 visitor visa and by working, she violated the terms of her visitor, or tourist, visa. 
Though a lawyer representing her told the AP he wasn’t familiar with the documents he also didn’t deny or challenge the veracity of them. 
On January 25, Trump issued an executive order prioritizing the deportation of people who have “engaged in fraud or willful misrepresentation in connection with any official matter or application before a governmental agency.” Credit: Pool/Getty Images 
Department of Homeland Security documents released this week indicate these instructions are currently being enforced and, according to Slate , had this been the 90s, Trump’s wife — known then as Melania Knaus — would have been considered a deportation priority. 
“If the current executive order on interior enforcement and the related Homeland Security memoranda on interior enforcement had been in effect at that time, then [Melania] would have certainly been an enforcement priority,” deputy attorney Hasan Shafiqullah confirmed to Slate . 
Of course, the mother of one has since become a naturalized U.S. citizen so this is no longer a cause of concern for her. 
Still, it’s interesting that had these rules existed so many years ago, Donald and Melania may have never met.
